title: Coolant Replacement - Drainage

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Before you disassemble the coolant hoses, note the orientation and position of the hose clips to help make sure that you install them in the same positions and orientation during assembly.
to remove and install the coolant hose constant tension hose clips.
Position the motorcycle on level ground and place on a paddock stand.
Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot.
When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the cooling system will be hot and may also be under pressure.
Contact with this hot, pressurised coolant may cause minor or moderate injury.
Remove the fixing and remove the coolant pressure cap.
Position a container to collect the displaced coolant.
Loosen the hose clip then release the bottom hose from the radiator and allow the coolant to drain.
Remove the drain bolt from the coolant outlet tube, located next to the heat exchanger and allow the coolant to drain.
